featured.text: All we hear is the scratching of pencil on paper, the sound of pigeons, and the delivery of inter-office correspondence by paper airplane. Wonderful!
In 2016, the city council decided to put its 85,000 pigeon population on a birth control pill to block the formation of eggs in birds.
First, we replaced all our telephones with carrier pigeons.

other.text: It was predicted that there would be a decrease of 20 percent in the pigeon population in the first year and between 70 and 80 percent in four or five years.
After heated debates and discussions, the government was finally persuaded to consider another 19 effective method: giving the pigeons birth control.
The city council originally proposed 18 the pigeon population by gathering the birds and shooting them.

definition.zh_def: 鴿子，一種常見的鳥類，通常有圓圓的身體和短短的尾巴，常見於城市和鄉村。
definition.en_def: A pigeon is a common bird with a rounded body and short tail, often found in urban and rural areas.
definition.example: The pigeon landed on the windowsill, cooing softly.
